definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
to call/to cry/to shout/to breath out/to exhale

sentences.english: that people in the next room have complained lately.
sentences.chinese: 他打呼嚕太響最近連隔壁房間的人都抱怨。

sentences.english: Sharing a bed with a partner who tosses and turns or kicks or snores can give you just as much trouble falling asleep.
sentences.chinese: 如果伴侶睡覺總是翻來動去或打呼嚕，那也真夠鬧心。

sentences.english: Or maybe a pretty tabby cat purring on your lap?
sentences.chinese: 還是一隻可愛的虎斑貓在你大腿上打呼嚕？

sentences.english: If you are snoring, then you cannot be dreaming.
sentences.chinese: 如果你正在打呼嚕，那麼你就沒在做夢。
雖然醉鬼酣睡又打呼嚕。

sentences.english: No, Comrade Li, we don't snore; and we don't fart either.
sentences.chinese: 不，李同志，我們不打呼嚕，而且連屁也不放。

sentences.english: My pa has snored disease, how should use spirit way to be being pressed aerate cure?
sentences.chinese: 我爸有打呼嚕的病，要怎麼利用氣道正壓通氣治療？

sentences.english: So thanks, honey, for telling me I snore.
sentences.chinese: 所以，親愛的，謝謝你告訴我打呼這件事。

sentences.english: Of course, maybe all these women date men who snore.
sentences.chinese: 當然也許她們交往的男人都愛打呼嚕。

sentences.english: Children with large tonsils often snore.
sentences.chinese: 那些扁桃體較大的小孩就經常打呼嚕。

sentences.english: Anyone who snores, therefore, should try to eat less than the average person and to exercise more. 5The following appeared in the editorial section of a local newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 因此，所有打呼嚕的人都應該比正常人少喫多鍛鍊。

sentences.english: Because my nose allergy problem, it makes my nose stuffy and I snore while falling asleep sometimes.
sentences.chinese: 因爲我鼻子過敏，所以有時睡覺會打呼因爲鼻子不通。

sentences.english: Yulia: I love to sleep. I take some sleeping pills and snoring all the way.
sentences.chinese: 我愛睡覺，我會喫些安眠藥然後ㄧ打呼到終點。

sentences.english: When the man goes to bed, the sound snoring clearly is from nose about li of effluence.
sentences.chinese: 男人睡覺時打呼嚕的聲音明明是從鼻子裏發出來的。

definition: to grind one's teeth (during sleep)/pointless arguing/(coll.) molar
talking in one's sleep/words spoken during sleep/fig. speech bearing no relation to reality/delusions
grumpiness associated with poor sleep/irritability in the morning
to wake sb up with a noise
